titleInfo.title: "Zelenaya Roshtitsa" (folk song); "Duniushka" (folk song); Ivan the Terible ("Wedding"); Tale of the Stone Flower ("Dance of the Russian precious stones"); Romeo and Juliet ("Morning Serenade"); Evgenii Onegin ("Polka")

location.physicalLocation: Serge Prokofiev Archive at Goldsmiths College, University of London

mods.note: Volume of folk songs as well as excerpts from Prokofiev's large-scale works arranged for Russian folk orchestra. Includes arrangements by V. Smirnov, A. Tonin, V. Boyashov, V. Fedoseev, and D. Golubev. Volume edited by Vladimir Blok.

titleInfo.title: Любовь къ тремъ Апельсинамъ/L'Amour des trois Oranges

location.physicalLocation: Serge Prokofiev Archive at Goldsmiths College, University of London

mods.note: Front page inscribed "Propriété de Serge Prokofiev" in black marker. The first page contains a pasted on sheet with a typed German translation of this page. Inside, the German translation is written in purple pen in a hand that does not appear to be the composer's. According to an added loose note inside, the German translation may have been made for a performance on October 9, 1926 in Berlin. This score also contains a number of pencil correction to the music and text.

mods.identifier: Subseries III.1: Prokofiev Collected Works, Belwin Mills

location.physicalLocation: Serge Prokofiev Archive at Goldsmiths College, University of London- Christopher Palmer Collection (1946-1995)

mods.note: Vocal score by Lev Atovmyan. English version by A. Steiger. Inside cover has two reviews of a concert which included this work from the February 1, 1988 edition of the Telegraph. The concert was by the Philharmonia Orchestra conducted by Yevgeny Svetlanov and also included Tchaikovsky's Fifth Symphony.
